page.title: 06Kingford Farm.(Tavistock)1
page.content: The name Kingford goes back to the tenth century when the farm was on the border of Tavistock Manor.Mr.Blowey, who owns Kingford Farm,keeps some dairy cows,beef cattle,sheep and grows some crops.He employs one worker and his son also helps.He keeps the dairy cows near to the farm so they can be easily brought in for milking.He keeps the sheep and beef cattle further away from the farm.He goes to check his livestock every day.Mr. Blowey has 42 dairy cows which are Friesians.He sells the milk to the Ambrosia factory at Lifton where it is used to make rice pudding and other milk products.He gets 1100 gallons of milk per cow,per year.The cows are milked at 7 a.m.and 5 p.m.In winter he keeps the cows in stalls.They are fed kale and concentrates whilst being milked and silage at night.
